title: Former NASA administrator hates Artemis, wants to party like it’s 2008

title: ClearSpace Debris Removal Mission Passes Key Milestones
summary:
A space debris removal mission being developed by Swiss startup ClearSpace has passed a pair of milestones as part of its environmental test campaign. ClearSpace-1 is an active debris removal mission that aims to capture and deorbit a Vega payload adapter that was launched in 2013 carrying three satellites. To capture its 112-kilogram target, the […]
The post ClearSpace Debris Removal Mission Passes Key Milestones appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Tianzhou-7 reaches Tiangong in China’s first space station mission of 2024
summary: The Tianzhou-7 cargo spacecraft docked at China’s Tiangong space station Wednesday to resupply the orbital outpost.

title: Daily Telescope: In which the space station proves it truly is international
summary: "We had parked our canal boat for the night..."

title: Viasat showcases navigation capability the UK lost after Brexit
summary: Viasat has successfully demonstrated a satellite navigation signal on an airplane that could help the United Kingdom replace capabilities lost after leaving the European Union, the operator announced Jan. 18.

title: Italian Startup to Test Muscle Monitoring Suit Aboard AX-3 Spaceflight
summary:
REA Spazio will conduct its first in-orbit test of the company’s Electrical Muscle Simulation (EMSi) spacesuit aboard the SpaceX Axiom Mission 3 (AX-3) flight, which is expected to be launched from the Kennedy Space Center later today. With the EMSi suit, REA hopes to reproduce the same muscular stimulation the human body receives on Earth […]
The post Italian Startup to Test Muscle Monitoring Suit Aboard AX-3 Spaceflight appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Astrobotic confirms Peregrine reentry plans
summary: Astrobotic confirmed Jan. 17 that its Peregrine lunar lander will reenter over the South Pacific on Jan. 18, concluding a 10-day mission that failed to land on the moon because of a propellant leak.

title: Artemis Gets Strong Support from House Committee Members, But Not Mike Griffin
summary: Members of the House Science, Space and Technology Committee expressed strong support for NASA’s Artemis program today. Citing the need for U.S. leadership in space, especially to get U.S. astronauts […]

title: DoD seeks less space classification, more collaboration with allies and commercial partners
summary: The Department of Defense is pushing to lower classification barriers and forge closer partnerships with the commercial space industry, John Plumb, assistant secretary of defense for space policy, said Jan. 17.

title: House committee backs Artemis despite latest delay
summary: Members of a key congressional committee expressed disappointment over the latest delay in NASA’s plans to return humans to the moon but showed little interest in making major changes to that program.
